empty.descriptionCommitmentFilter: No person from your Trust Circle has created or is interested in a commitment yet.

trustCircle.title: Trust Circle
trustCircle.text1: What information we believe has a lot to do with trust. Add people whose opinions you value to your Trust Circle. This allows you to see in your feed when they capture a question, answer questions, agree to answers, and much more. If a lot of people lead you in their Trust Circle, you have a large reach in the network. For example, if you are interested in a question, this means that many people see it in their feed.

question.title: Question
question.text1: Elyoos is all about answering questions. You can contribute to this process in many ways:
question.text2: Ask questions you are interested in and which have not yet been asked on Elyoos.
question.text3: Answer questions with your own words, a video, a book, a link or a commitment.
question.text4: Agree answers. In this way, you help ensure that the most relevant answers are displayed first.
question.text5: Mark questions as interesting. This way your Trust Circle sees which questions you are interested in and you stay up to date when new answers are added.

commitment.title: Commitment
commitment.text1: A commitment at Elyoos is an association, a project, an organisation or your personal commitment to a better world. Commitments are an important part of the platform and can be used as answers to questions. In this way, the user receives important information about who is dealing with a specific question.
commitment.text2: Alice, for example, is interested in the question 'How can zero waste be implemented in everyday life?'. In answer to this question, Bob captured a Zero Waste store near where Alice lives. She now knows where she can shop in order to use less packaging material.

support.title: Support us
support.description: Elyoos is still in its very beginning. Find out here how you can support us.

general.title: General information
general.point2: This privacy policy applies to the entire Elyoos service
general.point3: Responsible for the processing of personal data is the association Elyoos

processingData.title: How is your personal data processed?

general.title: General statement about the purposes of data processing
general.text1: Essentially, we process personal data in order to meet our obligations towards our users. The processing of the data is the prerequisite for us to be able to suggest questions, answers and further information to you, for example.

informationProvideToUs.title: Information you provide to us.
informationProvideToUs.text1: This is information that we receive directly from you and information that you post on the Elyoos website, for example:
informationProvideToUs.point2: Profile information (e.g. photo, description about you, which questions you have created, etc.)

informationAutomaticallyObtain.title: Information we automatically obtain through your use of Elyoos
informationAutomaticallyObtain.text1: While you use or visit the Elyoos service, data is automatically collected from you via tracking (Matomo) and log files on our servers. We store the collected data for up to 90 days in complete form. We use tracking for the following reasons:

informationFromOtherSource.title: Information we obtain about you from other sources
informationFromOtherSource.text1: If someone on Elyoos invites a person who doesn't have an account yet, we save this email address. Invited non-users can object to the sending of further invitations or invitation reminders to the respective e-mail address via an opt-out link in the invitation e-mail.

whoReceiveInformation.title: Who may receive information about you?
whoReceiveInformation.text1: We will only pass on your personal data to third parties if...
whoReceiveInformation.point1: You allow us to do this in the privacy settings.
whoReceiveInformation.point2: We are legally, judicially or officially obliged to do so.

userRights.title: Rights of the user
userRights.text1: As a user, you have the right to request free information on what personal data has been stored about you. You also have the right to have false data corrected and to have your personal data processed or deleted. If applicable, you may also assert your right to data portability. If you believe that your data has been processed unlawfully, you can file a complaint with the competent supervisory authority.

deleteData.title: Deletion of data
deleteData.text1: Unless your wish conflicts with a legal obligation to keep data, you have a right to have your data deleted. Data stored by us will be deleted if it is no longer necessary for your purpose and there are no legal retention periods. If deletion is not possible because the data is required for legal purposes, data processing will be restricted. In this case, the data will be blocked and not processed for other purposes.

rightOfObjection.title: Right of objection
rightOfObjection.text1: Users of this website may exercise their right of objection and object to the processing of their personal data at any time. If you wish to have your personal data stored corrected, blocked, deleted or informed, or if you have any questions regarding the collection, processing or use of your personal data, or if you wish to withdraw your consent, please contact us at the following e-mail address: info@elyoos.org

question1.title: What distinguishes Elyoos from other social networks?
question1.text1: In most social networks, individual posts such as pictures, texts or videos are posted and grouped with hashtags at most, as for example on Twitter. In Elyoos, these posts are assigned to a question as an answer. This makes it easier for users to find the information relevant to them.
question1.text2: Another important point is that Elyoos is completely advertising free and is one hundred percent financed by donations. In addition, we focus our content on the goal mentioned in Vision.

question2.title: What are the most important concepts at Elyoos?

question3.title: What is a commitment?
question3.text1: A commitment at Elyoos can be an association, a project, an organisation or your personal commitment to a better world. Commitments are an important part of the platform and can be used as answers to questions. In this way, the user receives important information about who is dealing with a specific question.
question3.text2: Alice, for example, is interested in the question 'How can zero waste be implemented in everyday life?'. In answer to this question, Bob captured a Zero Waste store near where Alice lives. She now knows where she can shop in order to use less packaging material.

question4.title: Should I enter commitments that I do not represent?
question4.text1: No. Commitments should only be recorded by those persons who represent the commitment itself. However, you have the option to send an email generated by Elyoos to a person with a commitment to draw their attention to this platform.

question5.title: What is a Trust Circle?
question5.text1: What information we believe has a lot to do with trust. Add people whose opinions you value to your Trust Circle. This allows you to see in your feed when they capture a question, answer questions, agree to answers, and much more. If a lot of people lead you in their Trust Circle, you have a large reach in the network. For example, if you are interested in a question, this means that many people see it in their feed.

question6.title: How does information spread over the network?
question6.text1: This works in a similar way to other social networks. Example:
question6.text2: If a person creates a question, people see this in their feed which have this person in their trust circle.
question6.text3: If a person finds the question interesting or answers it, the people who have this person in their Trust Circle will see it.

question7.title: Why are answers up voted?
question7.text1: Up voting answers should ensure that the most relevant ones appear first. This way you don't have to scroll long until you find the right answers.

question8.title: Are my questions visible to people without an account?
question8.text1: When you create a question, it is initially only visible to people with a user account. An administrator of Elyoos will decide whether your question will also become public. In this way, we want to ensure that issues of general interest are visible to the outside world.

question9.title: What are the advantages of an account?
question9.text1: An account allows you to create questions, answers and commitments. In addition, you keep up to date with which topics the people you know deal with. This way you can also see questions that are not visible without a user account.  Another important advantage is that you can filter the answers to a question by your trust circle. You'll learn how the people you trust think about a topic.

question10.title: Is my profile visible to non-members?
question10.text1: Your profile is only visible to people without accounts and search engines if you allow this in the privacy setting.

question11.title: How is the platform financed?
question11.text1: The development and operation of the platform is financed 100 percent by donations.

question12.title: Is the code of Elyoos open source?
question12.text1: Yes, to provide a better transparency regarding the algorithms used, the code is open source. This can be viewed at Github.
